taxon_name.authority: Rydberg in N. L. Britton et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe peritylinae;genus perityle;section laphamia;species megalocephala;variety megalocephala

bio:treatment.description: Plants 30–55 cm. Leaves: petioles 1–6 mm; blades ovate, lanceolate-ovate or elliptic to suborbiculate, 4–8(–12) × 3–9(–12) mm. Pappi callous crowns or of vestigial, hyaline scales. 2n = 34.
Crevices and rocky slopes in arid mountains;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety megalocephala is relatively common, growing usually in volcanic, also granitic and limestone rock in arid mountains of western and south-central Nevada and adjacent California. The lack of rays and pappus bristles separates var. megalocephala from the similar Perityle stansburii.
